title: Interchange the variables $$x$$ and $$y$$
speech: Replace , x  with  y  and then  y  with  x .

title: What's the equation after replacing $$x$$ with $$y$$ and $$y$$ with $$x$$
speech: x   is equal to   parentheses, 3 y minus 2,  raised to the 1 fifth power
pacedSpeech: , 3 y minus 2,  raised to the 1 fifth power

title: Solve for $$y$$
text: We can rise both sides to the fifth power then add $$2$$ both sides. It gives $$x^5+2=3y$$. We can isolate $$y$$ on one sides by dividing $$3$$ both sides which gives $$y$$ =(x**5 +2)/3. We can further simplify it into $$y$$ $$=\frac{1}{3} x^5+\frac{2}{3}$$ which is the final answer.
speech: We can rise both sides to the fifth power then add  2  both sides. It gives  x to the fifth, plus 2 is equal to 3 y . We can isolate  y  on one sides by dividing  3  both sides which gives  y  =(x**5 +2)/3. We can further simplify it into  y   is equal to, 1 third x to the fifth, plus 2 thirds  which is the final answer.
